alert.note: Alert for Deaf Smith; Oldham (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 02 at 12:42PM CDT by NWS Amarillo
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of western Oldham and northwestern Deaf Smith Counties through 130 PM CDT... At 1241 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 6 miles east of Glenrio, or 27 miles west of Vega, moving north at 35 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Glenrio. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. This storm may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 800 PM CDT for the Panhandle of Texas.
